abstract: Mike Stewart, the global head of proprietary trading at JPMorgan Chase, is leaving the bank to start his own hedge fund, as banks reorganize their operations ahead of the implementation of the so-called Volcker Rule.
snippet: Mike Stewart, the global head of proprietary trading at JPMorgan Chase, is leaving the bank to start his own hedge fund, as banks reorganize their operations ahead of the implementation of the so-called Volcker Rule.
lead_paragraph: LONDON – Mike Stewart, the global head of proprietary trading at JPMorgan Chase, is leaving the bank to start his own hedge fund, according to a person with direct knowledge of the matter.

headline.main: Top JPMorgan Trader to Start Own Hedge Fund

lead_paragraph: Top JPMorgan Trader to Start Own Hedge Fund  |  Mike Stewart, the global head of proprietary trading at JPMorgan Chase, is leaving the bank to start his own hedge fund, according to a person with direct knowledge of the matter.

abstract: At JPMorgan Chase’s investor day last week, the bank’s chief executive, Jamie Dimon, told a joke about pay at newspapers, comments that some took as a mockery of a struggling industry.
snippet: At JPMorgan Chase’s investor day last week, the bank’s chief executive, Jamie Dimon, told a joke about pay at newspapers, comments that some took as a mockery of a struggling industry.
lead_paragraph: At JPMorgan Chase‘s investor day last week, Jamie Dimon told a roomful of investors and analysts what was supposed to be a joke.

headline.main: Why Banking Chiefs Shouldn’t Tell Jokes
